::Prowl/Firearm::

<YEEEHAAA!> That's the thought that went through Prowl's mind as he 
flew low above the trees, going over 300 mph now. This new body was 
amazing! He looks forward, swirling just in time to avoid a mountain 
peak. They were now flying over a mountain range, 350 mph and 
speeding up.

Prowl's excitement finally clears enough for him to hear Iron 
Raptor's thoughts. His eyes widen. He didn't realize that this would 
scare her so much!

The Maximal could feel Iron Raptor hanging on to him, her body 
pressed against his. He could feel how fast her sparkbeat was, along 
with the fear she was feeling. Even thought the feel of her body 
pressing into his excited him, he didn't like freaking her out. Prowl 
slows down as he recieves her thought. She didn't sound very happy.

The two clear the mountain range, now going only about 150 mph. He 
hears her tell him to land.

Before he realizes that it might scare her, Prowl cuts off his 
boosters. The momentuum carries the two bots forward for a few 
seconds before sending them tumbling down toward the earth. The world 
spun around Prowl as the ground neared...

He reactivates his boosters at the last second, stabalizing and 
landing on his feet. Prowl loosens his arms around Iron Raptor, 
hoping she wouldn't kill him for that flight.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Firearm chuckles, smiling as he watches Prowl and Iron Raptor 
dissapear in the distance.

"Maybe. I'd hate to be the bot racing him, though!"

Firearm transforms into tank mode and drives up to Iris. "Hop on and 
hang on tight, this might be a bumpy ride."

He laughs. "I don't think I can make it as good as he did, but I'll 
try my best!"







--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> 
> * Iron Raptor glanced towards Iris for a moment before looking back 
towards 
> Prowl.*
> 
> < Well, I was never a fast learner anyway.>
> 
> * A last glance was exchanged between Iris mand Iron Raptor before 
Prowl 
> responded and slid his arm around her and took a strong hold.
> She didn't really like flying, but she guessed that since she had 
been given 
> wings she might as well get use to it.*
> 
> < Remember, Iris, right to the meeting.>
> 
> * Iris simply nodded and stood back a bit.*
> 
> IRIS: < Yeah, yeah, I know. But YOU remember, don't let the 
featherhead get 
> all the glory from now on. And if you aren't back by morning I'm 
coming to 
> look for you.>
> 
> * Iron Raptor was just about to begin arguing once again when she 
heard 
> Prowls' bosters power up, sliding her arms around his neck.*
> 
> < Fine.>
> 
> * Was all she was able to get out before Prowl took off, closing 
her eyes 
> tightly, the air feeling as if she was constantly being hit by a 
wall. Her 
> sensors detecting their speed, 100 mph!
> Iron Raptor was almost basically plastered to Prowl, and it wasn't 
just the 
> pressure of the air either. They were high and going very fast, 
which was 
> sending her speak thumping in her chest at nearly the same speed as 
they 
> were flying.*
> 
> < Prowl! Slow down!>
> 
> * There was no use in speaking because, with their speed, her voice 
would 
> have been lost.
> Iron Raptor tightens her hold on Prowl a bit, opening her eyes 
slightly to 
> look into his face.
> But then she heard his thought, and tightened her hold on him just 
as he had 
> instructed. But why?
> Seconds later she found out.
> The ground was rushing up towards them, and she knew that Prowl was 
excited 
> and all, but her spark nearly stopped from fright alone as he 
suddenly 
> bankes up from the ground. Her mind seemingly consumed by the white 
hot 
> light which obviously resembled her fear.
> This wasn't fun at all! It wasn't funny either!
> She whimpered a little and shook visably, obviously it was clear 
that she 
> had been scared out of her mind.
> Battles she could take, beasts she could handle, even pain she had 
no 
> problem with, but heights....
> There wasn't anything else in the world she hated more then hights.
> Iron Raptor breathed hard and tried to calm her spark, finding it 
rather 
> difficult.
> Her eyes became a little wet but the air dried them before she had 
a chance 
> to shed a tear, obviously desturbed.*
> 
> < Prowl...slow down.>
> 
> * That was the only thought she could get out, the remainder of her 
mind 
> still recovering from the extreme shock she felt moments before.
> She hated heights, and Prowl had only made it worse.
> How could she ever learn to fly if Prowl scared her witless like 
this?
> But she regained her composure, even though her mind was still 
reeling. But 
> finally she decided that she didn't want her friends to see her 
shaken up 
> like this, her own body still physically shaking.*
> 
> < Land a ways from the site.>
> 
> ____________________________________IRIS
> 
> * Iris only watched as Prowl took off, knowing for a fact that Iron 
Raptor 
> wouldn't like it one bit.
> Then seeing, in the distance, Prowl take a dive towards the land 
and then 
> continue on his way towards the new ship.*
> 
> < Fool! >
> 
> * But then she looked towards Firearm as he spoke, narrowing her 
optics at 
> him from under her helm.*
> 
> " Knows how to fly, my tin plated ass! All he knows how to do is 
scare that 
> woman slagless!"
>
